physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient presented with short stature, height SDS -3.3 for age and sex.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Growth retardation became obvious at the age of 5 3/12 years. Initial short stature diagnosis at age 6 years.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At age 7.2 years, height was 99 cm (SDS -5.9).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient underwent pituitary function testing showing low peak levels of GH during sleep (3.2 ng/ml) and arginine stimulation (2.4 ng/ml).

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient II:1 referred for evaluation of short stature and had a small anterior pituitary gland occupying 50% of the fossa on CT scan.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Human pituitary-derived GH was started but stopped in 1985; rhGH was later introduced and discontinued at age 16.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At retesting off GH at 16.6 years, peak GH levels were 5.8 ng/ml during arginine stimulation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: IGF-I level at age 25 years was low at 101 ng/ml (normal range 127â€“360 ng/ml).
